content.question: The function <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gives the cost, in dollars, to produce a particular product, where <math alttext="C of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is the cost, in dollars, to produce <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> units of the product. The function <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="M of x, equals, C, times, open parenthesis, x plus 1, close parenthesis, minus C of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>C</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> gives the marginal cost, in dollars, to produce unit number <math alttext="x plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the best estimate for the marginal cost, in dollars, to produce the 57th unit of the product?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator C of 56, and denominator 56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>56</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>56</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator C of 57, and denominator 57, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator C of 56, and denominator 56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>57</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>57</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>C</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>56</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>56</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C prime of 57, minus C prime of 56" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mn>57</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mn>56</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
